senses.sense_definition: A combined entity that has a value, quality, or significance greater than the simple total of its individual parts.

examples.text: The team's collaboration created an <w>oversum</w>, achieving results far beyond what they could do individually.
In this philosophical theory, society is viewed as an <w>oversum</w> rather than just a collection of people.

senses.sense_definition: To calculate a total incorrectly resulting in a number that is higher than the actual amount.

examples.text: The auditor discovered that the clerk had <w>oversummed</w> the daily receipts by a significant margin.
If you <w>oversum</w> the expenses, the final balance sheet will not match the bank records.
